definitions.definition: Of an object, concept, relationship, etc., having existed for a relatively long period of time.
definitions.example: an old abandoned building;  an old friend

definitions.definition: Having been used and thus no longer new or unused.
definitions.example: I find that an old toothbrush is good to clean the keyboard with.

definitions.definition: Having existed or lived for the specified time.
definitions.example: How old are they? She’s five years old and he's seven. We also have a young teen and a two-year-old child.
Your constant pestering is getting old.

definitions.definition: Said of subdued colors, particularly reds, pinks and oranges, as if they had faded over time.
A grammatical intensifier, often used in describing something positive. (Mostly in idioms like good old, big old and little old, any old and some old.)
definitions.example: We're having a good old time. My next car will be a big old SUV.  My wife makes the best little old apple pie in Texas.
